text: [Music]
hi I'm the PSLE party from Amazon Web
Services today I'm going to walk you
through a few simple rules to follow
when launching Amazon ec2 spot instances
spot instances enable you to optimize
costs on a AWS cloud and scale your
applications throughput up to 10 times
for the same budget in this video I'll
show you two simple rules to follow when
thinking about launching spot instances
rule one spot pools have separate prices
and change less frequently each instance
type size and availability zone in every
region is a separate spot pool for
example c32 extra large in US east one c
has a separate price and see for 8 extra
large in US east fancy has a separate
price price for c 3 2 extra large in US
east one c is ten point nine cents right
now but it could be nine cents tomorrow
and it adjusts based on long-term supply
and demand rule 2 Amazon ec2 will give
you a two-minute warning when we need
the capacity back
you can request spot capacity similar to
on-demand and always pay the current
spot price when we need the capacity
back you will get a two-minute one we
send you the notification where spot
instant status there are two reasons
your spot instance could be marked for
termination because the current spot
price has rising above your maximum
willingness to pay or capacity is no
longer available to serve your instance
the bit status of your spot instance
request is set to marked for termination
and spot termination time metadata is
set to a time precisely two minutes in
the future in this video we have
discussed two simple rules to follow
when launching Amazon ec2 spot instances
you can find more information at
aws.amazon.com / ec2 slash spot thanks
for watching
